[Tangleroot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tangleroot), [Reassembling Skeleton](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reassembling Skeleton), [Ashnod's Altar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ashnod's Altar) and [Bog Initiate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bog Initiate) gives you infinite black mana to infinitely sac [Reassembling Skeleton](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reassembling Skeleton) to Grimgrin.  
There's also the Thopter Foundry combo: [Thopter Foundry](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thopter Foundry), [Krak-Clan Ironworks](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Krak-Clan Ironworks) and [Sword of the Meek](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sword of the Meek). This'll give you infinite 1/1 tokens that you can infinitely sacrifice to Grimgrin (and infinite life and mana).  
Hmm.. 2 [Myr Retriever](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Myr Retriever)s, [Tangleroot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tangleroot) and a [Krak-Clan Ironworks](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Krak-Clan Ironworks) perhaps? In all cases, you could probably use the infinite combo for something better; hit your opponent for 1 million with [Consume Spirit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Consume Spirit), swing with a billion thopter tokens on your next turn or replace [Tangleroot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tangleroot) with [Desciple of the Vault](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Desciple of the Vault) :/

posts.post_content:
Zombie Shenanigans in EDH  
[Grimgrin, Corpse-Born](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grimgrin, Corpse-Born)  
[Rooftop Storm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rooftop Storm)  
[Gravecrawler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gravecrawler)  
[Diregraf Captain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Diregraf Captain)  
Drop Rooftop Storm, grab Grimgrin from the Command zone, Play Gravecrawler and Diregraf Captain.   
Sacrifice Gravecrawler to Grimgrin, play from graveyard for ![0](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=0&type=symbol). Rinse and repeat.  
Grimgrin becomes an infinite/infinite and any player you choose loses infinite life.  
Also, you can throw in a [Demon's Horn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Demon's Horn) for infinite life, use [Savra, Queen of the Golgari](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Savra, Queen of the Golgari) in a casual deck to force them to sack an infinite number of creatures...lots of utility with the right cards.
posts.html:
Zombie Shenanigans in EDH
Grimgrin, Corpse-Born
Rooftop Storm
Gravecrawler
Diregraf Captain
Drop Rooftop Storm, grab Grimgrin from the Command zone, Play Gravecrawler and Diregraf Captain.
Sacrifice Gravecrawler to Grimgrin, play from graveyard for . Rinse and repeat.
Grimgrin becomes an infinite/infinite and any player you choose loses infinite life.
Also, you can throw in a Demon's Horn for infinite life, use Savra, Queen of the Golgari in a casual deck to force them to sack an infinite number of creatures...lots of utility with the right cards.

posts.post_content: The ability to untap him at any time is largely unnoticed, and horrifyingly powerful. [Sunblast Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sunblast Angel)? Sac an already tapped creature in response. One of my favorite uses of the untap ability is when I'm up against [Royal Assassin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Royal Assassin). I go to untap Grimgrin, they use the Assassin in response. In response to the assassin, I sac another dude and their ability fizzles. They never see it coming.
posts.html:
